body:
In 1.8, since blockhitting was considered a glitch, mojang is going to be taking it out. Also, here's some other combat system updates that are coming.
-TnT can now flow in water (breaks certain cannons)
-Can't punch the ground while drinking potions
-Can't punch when bow is being pulled back
-Can't punch the ground while eating food
body_tagged:
In 1.8, since blockhitting was considered a glitch, mojang is going to be taking it out. Also, here's some other combat system updates that are coming.
-TnT can now flow in water (breaks certain cannons)
-Can't punch the ground while drinking potions
-Can't punch when bow is being pulled back
-Can't punch the ground while eating food
title: Thoughts on Blockhitting being taken out?

replies.body: Block hitting is a tactic used in pvp, even if people think it's cheap, unfair, or just bad. It's just like saying strafing is bad and unfair people it makes people win fights. Yes I'm sad to see this be taken out of the game as it is a tactic that anyone could pull out and get the upper hand in a fight. Yes the combos are crazy that you can get but that is because of the combo of 1.7 and block hitting so one of them had to be removed for the insane combo to be removed.

replies.body: I see lots of people raging at block hitters I get mad too but I do it all the time. Except I don't just stand there and hit I have my finger constantly on the control key so if I stop block hitting I can run and stuff. What I'm saying is run up to a person and pvp as fast and effectively as non block hitters. It's a really good strategy and does involve some skill if you're doing it right like I am. Standing there doing nothing but hitting.requires little to no skill.

replies.body:
Block-hitting was a glitch, it gave an unfair advantage to those who can get insane combos because of ping.
the EULA stopped/is stopping pay to win servers.
i get people have adapted to it but because they are used to it doesn't mean it's good...
also, I dislike the other changes but they make the game a bit more realistic. (Not that anyone really cares about realism .-.)

replies.body:
It didn't give an unfair advantage to those with good ping. No one was ever forced to make a payment to any server, and if they think that the gameplay is unfair, they just have to press the escape button on their keyboard and then press "Disconnect".

Im Australian, I can block hit as well as most American or Canadian players. Some of the best block hitter come from places such as Europe, and making claims that it is an advantage to those with better ping is outrageous and incorrect.

Should I ask Mojang to remove the ability to move while hitting someone? Because hey, people with better ping can strafe easier. Should I ask them to remove pvp all together, because again, there is a slight ping advantage.

replies.body:
Block-hitting haves player with a low ping an easy way to get huge combos (if you can click fast enough)

The EULA is useful because it is stopping the pay to win aspects in minecraft servers, I was never saying anyone was forced to pay...

a slight advantage from from ping is fine, when I play au servers I get a ping under 20, it doesn't make too big a difference with moving and strafing but makes a large difference with hits. If you can click fast enough with good ping the hits will keep on registering out of hit distance.

replies.body: Pay to win isn't an issue if you aren't paying. If someone doesn't enjoy the server, I don't see what's so difficult about not playing it. You are incorrect about block hitting.
